data.title: Company Overview & News
data.text:
Why Solo Apps Just Don’t Work: A Kardashian Case Study

In a world where anyone can have a website or an app monetizing one's presence is require more than just something with a celebrity name on it.

Donald Trump Returns To X Ahead Of Elon Musk Interview—Tweeting For First Time In A Year

Former President Donald Trump posted on X, formerly known as Twitter, for just the second time since he was banned from the platform in the wake of the Jan. 6 riot.

Sade Charts Another No. 1–Their Second In Just Two Months

Sade's The Best of Sade launches at No. 1 on Billboard's Contemporary Jazz Albums chart, marking their second career leader—and second in as many months.

Disney Sets The Record Straight About Upcoming Theme Park Attraction

Disney has issued a rare clarification to clear up confusion about an upcoming theme park attraction after fans claimed the media giant had misled them.

Electric Trucks Nearly Killed Nikola. Now Hydrogen Ones Are Saving It.

The struggling electric truckmaker sells the first commercial fuel cell truck in the U.S., with twice the range of battery models — and so far, drivers love them.

A New Era Of Representation: Actively Black At The 2024 Paris Olympics

From traditional Adire prints to modern designs, see how Actively Black’s partnership with Team Nigeria at the Paris 2024 Olympics redefines sportswear excellence.

Red Hot Chili Peppers’ Classic Album Rocks To New Heights On Multiple Charts

The Red Hot Chili Peppers' Californication blasts back onto five Billboard charts this week. It reaches a new peak on three of them at the same time.

NSYNC’s ‘Bye Bye Bye’ Surges More Than 800% In Sales

Sales of NSYNC's “Bye Bye Bye” skyrocketed more than 800% after it was featured in the No. 1 movie in the world, Deadpool & Wolverine.

2024 Paris Olympics: Sifan Hassan Wins The Women’s Marathon With An Olympic Record

Dutch-Ethiopian athlete Sifan Hassan wins the women's marathon with an Olympic record. Eliud Kipchoge ends his Olympic career.

Warner Bros Discovery Shuts Down Cartoon Network Website

In the aftermath of a $9.1 billion write-down on their cable networks, WBD said they were shutting down the website of the Cartoon Channel.

Minnesota Twins’ Potential Superstar Walker Jenkins Must Stay Healthy

The Minnesota Twins could use power prospect Walker Jenkins right now. The 19-year-old outfielder isn’t ready for prime time. Injuries have curtailed his development.

A Department Store For Online Emerging Brands: Welcome To The First Co.Lab In Wales

Landsec and Lone Design Club have chosen Cardiff to test their debut department store for emerging D2C brands. The partnership, called Co.Lab will roll out in the U.K.

Real Madrid Superstar Rejects $1 Billion Offer From Saudi Arabia, MARCA Reports

One of Real Madrid's main men, Vinícius Júnior, has turned down an offer from Saudi Arabian side Al-Ahli which would have smashed the world record transfer fee.

Trump Intends To Sue DOJ Over Mar-A-Lago Search

The lawsuit comes after a Trump-appointed judge dismissed the criminal charges against Trump for allegedly withholding White House documents.

Meet The World’s Best Insurance Companies 2024

The insurers that made Forbes' lists—including NFU Mutual, AXA and Allianz—offer a balance of digital innovation and human connection.
